Abdullah Al Mamun is a leading figure in Bangladesh’s private sector, known for his strategic vision and transformative leadership at Delta Group.
Born and raised in Dhaka, he began his career trading textiles in the late 1970s before founding Delta Group in 1985, expanding into manufacturing, energy, and real estate.
Apart from his role at Delta Group, he serves on the boards of several financial institutions and chairs the National Chamber of Commerce’s export committee.
He established the Mamun Education Foundation in 2002, providing scholarships to underprivileged students in rural Bangladesh.
Recipient of the Lifetime Achievement Award in Industry by the Bangladesh Business Forum (2018) and honored with the National Export Excellence Medal in 2015.
Shahida Rahman is recognized for pioneering sustainable manufacturing in Bangladesh through GreenTech Industries.
After completing her MBA in London, she returned home in 1988 to launch a biodegradable packaging line, later diversifying into renewable energy.
She chairs the Bangladesh Renewable Energy Association and sits on the advisory council of the International Green Forum.
Founder of the Green Future Trust, supporting environmental education programs across the country since 2010.
Awarded the Eco-Innovator Prize by the Global Sustainability Council (2019) and the National Women in Industry Award (2016).
Arifur Rahman leads SeaLink Exports, one of Bangladesh’s top seafood exporters, with a focus on quality and international standards.
He started as a small fish trader in the 1970s, scaling operations to include processing plants and cold-chain logistics by 1995.
Serves as Vice President of the Bangladesh Fisheries Association and advisor to the Port Authority on export regulations.
Donates annually to coastal community development projects and runs vocational training centers for youth in Chittagong.
Honored with the Maritime Excellence Award (2014) and the Export Leadership Medal by the Ministry of Commerce (2011).
Nusrat Jahan is a seasoned strategist on the Horizon Textiles board, driving innovation in fabric technology.
Graduated in Economics and began her career in finance before shifting to textile manufacturing in 2000.
Also chairs the Audit Committee at Horizon and mentors startups through the Textile Innovation Hub.
Supports the Khulna Women’s Empowerment Fund, focusing on micro-loans and skills training for artisans.
Received the Corporate Governance Award (2017) and featured in ‘Top 50 Women Leaders’ by Industry Today (2019).
Rezaul Karim brings financial expertise to Bengal Pharma’s board, overseeing expansion into ASEAN markets.
Trained as a chartered accountant in London, he returned to Bangladesh in 1992 to join a leading audit firm before moving into pharma.
Also sits on the Investment Committee of the Bangladesh Securities Exchange and advises on healthcare finance.
Founded the Karim Health Trust, funding rural clinics and mobile health units since 2013.
Honored with the Finance Leadership Award (2018) and the Healthcare Investor Medal (2020).

name: Farid Amin
title: Director
known_for: Director of Finance at Apex Bank

description.content: Farida Yasmin is a veteran banker whose insights have strengthened Apex Bank’s financial controls.
Started as a credit officer in 1990, rising through risk management and treasury to become Finance Director in 2015.
Member of the Central Bank’s Financial Stability Council and advisor to the National Investment Board.
Champion of the Women in Finance Fellowship, mentoring young women in rural Bangladesh since 2016.
Received the Banking Excellence Award (2017) and honored as Finance Leader of the Year (2021).
Touhid Hossain oversees CargoLink’s nationwide distribution network, ensuring timely and cost-effective delivery.
Graduated in Industrial Engineering and joined a global courier firm before co-founding CargoLink in 2003.
Vice Chair of the National Shippers Council and member of the Transport Authority’s advisory panel.
Supports the Rangpur Skills Initiative, offering free logistics and warehousing training to unemployed youth.
Awarded the Logistics Innovation Medal (2018) and recognized as Entrepreneur of the Year by Transport Today (2020).

name: Lobina Sultana
title: Director
known_for: Director of Marketing at Nova Foods

description.content: Lobina Sultana leads brand strategy for Nova Foods, driving substantial market share growth in dairy products.
Started in advertising in the 1990s, joining Nova Foods in 2005 and revolutionizing their digital marketing approach.
Chair of the Marketing Professionals Forum and guest lecturer at Dhaka University Business School.
Initiated the Nova Food Bank Project, distributing meals to underprivileged communities during Ramadan since 2012.
Winner of the Marketer of the Year Award (2019) and the Digital Innovator Prize (2021).
Kamrul Hasan is a pioneer in Bangladesh’s IT sector, co-founding TechNova Solutions to deliver enterprise software.
After earning a computer science degree in 1982, he worked in Silicon Valley before returning home in 1990 to launch his first startup.
Advisor to the National ICT Task Force and board member of the Bangladesh Software Exporters Association.
Established the Code for Future initiative, teaching coding skills to rural students at no cost since 2015.
Recipient of the IT Visionary Award (2016) and the National Innovation Medal (2018).
Trishna Chakraborty is instrumental in shaping Vision Telecom’s long-term strategy and market expansion plans.
With a background in economics, she joined a global consultancy before moving into the telecom sector in 2000.
Serves on the national telecom regulatory advisory council and mentors startups in digital communications.
Leads the TechGirls initiative, empowering young women through scholarships and mentorship in STEM fields.
Honored with the Strategy Excellence Award (2017) and recognized among ‘Top 100 Global Female Leaders’ (2020).
